title.rendered: 5 Benefits of Replacing the Windows in Your Vaughan Home

content.rendered:
Replacing the windows in a home can be a big job, but there are many benefits to doing so. These benefits range from things having to do with aesthetics, functionality and more. If you are a homeowner looking to replace your windows for the first time, consider these reasons for window replacement and speak to a carpenter in Vaughan about the project.

1. New Windows Add to a Home’s Value

Making sure to keep your home’s value up is a worthy cause, particularly if you plan on eventually selling the house or passing it down to younger generations of the family. One of the main reasons why window replacements add to the value of a home is because of how much nicer they look compared to older windows that might have fog, scratches or other defects.

2. Replacement Windows Provide Clearer Views

Not only do new windows look better from the outside of the house, but they make for better views from the inside of the home looking outdoors. Being able to see the outside more clearly is a big quality of life benefit, particularly if you live someplace that has nice views. Most people would take down a picture on the wall if it became irreparably dirty or broken, and older windows should get the same treatment.

3. New Windows Give More Security

One of the main ways that people break into homes to steal property is by finding windows that no longer lock or latch properly. Would-be thieves often peruse neighbourhoods for houses that consistently have windows that are left ajar, which makes the execution of the crime go as quickly as possible.

In addition to providing new locks, newer windows tend to have better glass that is much more difficult to break than older glass. This can act as a deterrent to potential criminals since those who break and enter want to get in and out of the home before anyone walking or driving by spots them.

4. Newer Windows Are More Energy Efficient

Windows, especially ones that are large, can allow a lot of heat to escape a home during the winter and cool air to escape during the summer. This not only leads to frustration when trying to regulate inside air temperatures but contributes to higher electricity bills as well. There are repair services in Vaughan that can help you make changes to have a more energy-efficient house. In addition to replacing the windows, some other things you can do to increase your home’s energy efficiency include:

  • Using LED rather than traditional lightbulbs
  • Installing a tankless water heater
  • Making sure to replace your air filters every so often
  • Powering off and unplugging electronics when not in use 

In addition, installing new windows makes it more appealing to use natural light in the house during the day, which is another way to save on electricity costs.

5. Replacement Windows Have Greater Functionality

Over time, windows can become more difficult to open and close, which can be especially challenging to deal with for people who have limited mobility. Besides providing a view, windows exist so that you can get fresh air in the home on a nice day. Replacing your older windows with newer ones is a great way to increase their functionality and make them easier to use for everyone in the home.

If you are thinking about replacing your windows for one of these reasons or for any other reason, contact Handyman Connection and speak to one of our professionals. We have carpenters who specialize in window repair and replacement and can find the right solution for you.
